head.supplied: South Australia. ¶ MEMORANDUM OF TRANSFER. ¶ I, ¶ ¶ Ferdinand Jacob Heinrich "von Müller" ¶ , formerly ¶ "Müller" ¶ of Melbourne in the Province of Victoria ¶ being registered as the proprietor o...

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: center;

div.p:
I,
Ferdinand Jacob Heinrich "von Müller" , formerly "Müller" of Melbourne in the Province of Victoria being registered as the proprietor of an estate in fee simple subject, however, to such encumbrances, liens, and interests, as are notified by memoranda underwritten or endorsed hereon, in that piece of land situated in the Hundred of Macclesfield, County of Hindmarsh and containing two roods or thereabouts being portion of the allotment numbered " 133 " in the Township of Macclesfield bounded as appears in the plan in the margin of Certificate of Title Vol XLV Folio 207

In consideration of the sum of Fifteen Pounds Sterling paid to me by Heinrich Friedrich Wilhelm Dancker of Macclesfield storekeeper the receipt of which sum I hereby acknowledge, do hereby transfer to the said Heinrich Friedrich Wilhelm Dancker all my estate and interest in the said piece of land above described.
In witness whereof I have hereunto subscribed my name this twentynineth day of October one thousand eight hundred and sixty eight
Signed on the day above named by the said Ferdinand Jacob Heinrrich von Müller formerly Ferdinand Jacob Heinrich Müller

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
one of the judges of the Supreme Court of Victoria
A cover sheet identifies 'No. 24254 Memorandum of Transfer of part of lot 133 situated in Township of Macclesfield' from M as Vendor to Dancker as Purchaser; 'Particulars entered in the Register Book, Vol. XLV Folio 207, the 14 day of November, 1868 at Ten am', having been certified as 'Correct for purposes of Registration' by F. E. Krichauff, Licensed Land Broker.
